data.question: What is the DOI of the article discussing Chiral 3D Architectures with Helical Channels?
Which two compounds are mentioned as having significant induced optical activity in the POM moieties?
What is the role of proline in the synthesis of chiral POM-based materials?
data.answer: Proline acts as an enantioselective catalyst and allows extensive cross-linking between metal–organic moieties and oxygen-rich POM units.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of compounds d-1 and l-1 represents the first examples of homochiral 3D open-framework POM-based compounds with helical channels.
What is the yield percentage of compound d-1 based on copper?
What method is used for the preparation of compound d-1?
data.answer: Standard synthetic techniques involving the reaction of K5[BW12O40]·15 H2O with copper(ii) and d-proline in water.

data.question: True or False: The CD and UV/Vis spectra of compounds d-1 and l-1 change significantly over time.
What is the space group of compound d-1?
True or False: The Keggin cluster [BW12O40]5- was chosen as the building block due to its low charge density.
What is the main challenge in the construction of chiral 3D open frameworks mentioned in the text?
data.answer: Finding suitable chiral organic molecules, metal cations, and POM building units for the construction.

data.question: True or False: The dimensions of the channels in both compounds d-1 and l-1 are approximately 10.6 x 7.2 D.
What is the pitch of the right-handed single-helical chains in compound d-1?
True or False: The CD spectra of d-1 and l-1 in water are identical.
What is the main reason for the induced circular dichroism (ICD) in the POM clusters?
data.answer: Chirality transfer from the chiral proline ligands to the POM clusters through the copper bridges.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of compound l-1 starts with d-proline.
What is the yield percentage of compound l-1 based on copper?
What is the significance of the Keggin polyoxoanions in the structure of compounds d-1 and l-1?
data.answer: They act as achiral building units and are linked into a 3D framework by metal–proline coordination complexes.

data.question: What is the pH value adjusted to during the synthesis of compound d-1?
True or False: The observed chirality of d-1 and l-1 is due to their chiral space groups.
What is the role of water molecules in the structure of compounds d-1 and l-1?
data.answer: Water molecules fill the channels and participate in extensive hydrogen-bonding interactions.
